alert.note: Alert for Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 22 at 2:09PM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Indian River. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 206 PM EST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vero Beach, Indian River Shores, Vero Beach South, Gifford, Winter Beach, Pointe West, Vero Beach Highland, South Beach, Vero Beach Airport, Grovenor Estates, Florida Ridge, Jaycee Beach, Floralton Beach and Moorings Of Vero Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
